question_body: Hersilia was the Sabine wife of which Roman king?
Who so impressed the Falerii in 394 BC by his handling of a treacherous teacher that they surrendered immediately to Rome?
In 343 BC, with what city did Rome form an alliance?
When it was originally built in 312 BC, what city was the terminus of the Via Appia?
In 263 BC, which Roman commander defeated Hiero II in Sicily?
Whom did Tiberius Sempronius Longus join at the Trebia River in 218 BC against Hannibal?
Which of these was the strongest opponent of Cato's words, "Carthago delenda est"?
Where did the First Servile War of 135-132 BC take place?
In 110 BC, who was the immediate successor to Sp. Postumius Albinus in the war against Jugurtha?
In 68 BC, who defeated a group of pirates by conquering Crete?
What law gave Pompey the Great the command against Mithridates?
Why did M. Antonius have such an enduring hatred of Cicero?

question_options.A: He had humiliated Antony for his involvement in the Clodius Club.
question_options.B: He had favored Octavian in the Civil War.
question_options.C: He ordered the execution of his father during the Catilinarian conspiracy.
question_options.D: He delivered the Philippic orations against him

question_body: In an agreement in 39 BC, who was given Sicily, Sardinia, Corsica, and the southern part of Greece?
Which king of Rome first brought water to Rome via an aqueduct?
During the beginning of the Republic, who destroyed his palatial house so that he would not be compared to L. Tarquinius Superbus?
In 390 BC, under whose leadership did the Gauls become the first hostile people to occupy Rome?
After the death of Alexander the Great, the Asiatic portion of his empire, including Syria, Babylonia, and the Eastern regions fell under whose control?
At what battle in 262 BC did Rome first defeat Carthage?
Who was the immediate successor of Hamilcar Barca after Hamilcar's death in 228 BC?
The phalanx formation was used for the last time against Rome at what battle of 168 BC?
What people did Antiochus IV try to force to accept Greek culture?
Who was indicted on a charge that he had encouraged M. Livius Drusus in his sympathy for the Italian social cause?
What city was the capital of the Italians during the Social War?
In 77 BC, who was in control of Spain?
Crassus planned in 53 to travel along the Euphrates River to what capital of Parthia?
In 45 BC, ironically on March 15, at what battle was Caesar victorious?
Demaratus, the father of the Roman king L. Tarquinius Priscus, originally came from what city?
The battle won at what site ended the hope of L. Tarquinius Superbus' restoration as king of Rome?
In 350 BC, who were the only two peoples who represented dangers to Rome?
After the Roman victory at Sentinum in 295 BC, what tribe took no further part in the Samnite Wars?
What Roman made the first invasion of Africa during the First Carthaginian War?
What city never fell during wars against both Pyrrhus and Rome, but was ceded to Rome as a provision of the peace treaty at the end of the First Punic War?
In 197 BC, after succeeding his father Attalus of Pergamum, who begged Flamininus to order Antiochus out of Asia Minor?
What leader was finally defeated in 148 BC by Q. Caecilius Metellus to end the Fourth Macedonian War?
Which of these men was NOT a supporter of Ti. Sempronius Gracchus during his first tribunate?
Against whom was the Senatus Consultum Ultimum first used?
What city in 125 BC complained about the Gauls to Rome who then sent M. Fulvius Flaccus?
Which of these events in the life of Clodius happened in 62 BC?

question_options.A: He ran for the office of tribunus plebis
question_options.B: He violated the rites of the Bona Dea festival
question_options.D: He was kidnapped by Cilician pirates

question_body: Pompey the Great was murdered in Egypt due to the influence of which minister of Ptolemy XIII?
What consul of 495 BC helped push the plebeians to secede due to his strict enforcement of harsh laws?
The Samnites were able to focus their full attention on Rome after the defeat of what other enemy in 326 BC?
After his victory at Heraclea, what ambassador and friend did Pyrrhus send to negotiate a peace settlement?
After the First Illyrian War, what Greek island did Rome take possession of?
What city reneged on an alliance with Rome after it was weakened by the Gauls in 390 BC before being pacified and defeated by Cincinnatus?
Where did Hannibal retire to for 4 years before he returned to Carthage in 203 BC?
In terms of numbers killed, what was the worst non-Civil War defeat in Roman history?
Who, resenting the small war bonus he was given because of his avarice, tried to block L. Aemilius Paullus' triumph in 167 BC?
What law(s) opened the consulship to the plebeians in 367 BC?
Spartacus made an agreement with Cilician pirates to do which of these?

question_options.B: hinder the advancement of Cn. Pompeius Strabo Magnus

question_body: Caesarian forces under Curio were defeated in 49 BC by Pompeians led by whom?
